prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)

(:goal
  (and
    Explicame TODOS los cuadros
    (explained_painting ...)
  
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"

(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

1.  **Initial State & Goal**: The robot `tiago` begins at `home` with a full battery (100 units). The objective is to visit and explain all 31 paintings listed in the problem file. Each `explain_painting` action directly fulfills a part of this goal.

2.  **Battery Consumption**: A `move` action consumes 20 battery units and an `explain_painting` action consumes 10. To perform a `move`, the robot must have at least 20 battery units.

3.  **Optimal Tour Strategy**: The planner must decide how many paintings to visit before the battery gets too low.
    *   Visiting one painting and returning (`move`, `explain`, `move`) costs 20 + 10 + 20 = 50 battery. This is feasible.
    *   Visiting two paintings and returning (`move`, `explain`, `move`, `explain`, `move`) costs 20 + 10 + 20 + 10 + 20 = 80 battery. The robot returns to `home` with 20 battery left, which is safe.
    *   Attempting to visit three paintings is not possible. After explaining the third painting, the robot's battery would be at 10 units (100 - 3 * (20+10) = 10). This is insufficient to perform the `move` action (which requires 20 units) to return to `home` for a recharge. The robot would be stranded.

4.  **Recharge Planning**: Based on the above, the most efficient strategy is to visit two paintings per trip. This maximizes the number of goals achieved per recharge cycle. The robot must recharge when its battery level (40 units after the second explanation) is too low to guarantee a safe return trip to the charger after visiting another painting. Therefore, a recharge is performed after every two paintings are explained. Each `recharge` action is a necessary step to enable the subsequent set of goal actions.

5.  **Plan Execution**: The plan follows this "visit two, then recharge" cycle for the first 30 paintings. For the final painting, a single trip is made, as the overall goal is complete once it is explained. All `move` actions are necessary to position the robot to achieve the `explain_painting` goals, and all `recharge` actions are necessary to power those movements.

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

response:
Here is a step-by-step explanation of the planning process, focusing on battery management and goal satisfaction.

The primary goal is to make the robot `tiago` explain all 31 paintings listed in the problem file. The main constraint is the robot's battery, which starts at 100 units. Each `move` action costs 20 units, and each `explain_painting` action costs 10 units. The robot can only recharge at the `home` location.

**1. Devising an Efficient Tour Strategy**

To minimize movements and recharges, the robot should explain multiple paintings per trip before returning to `home`. A single trip is called a "tour". We need to find the maximum number of paintings the robot can explain in one tour.

*   **Cost Calculation:** A tour to explain `N` paintings involves:
    1.  One `move` from `home` to the first painting (P1).
    2.  `N-1` moves between paintings (P1 to P2, P2 to P3, etc.).
    3.  `N` `explain_painting` actions.
    4.  One final `move` from the last painting (PN) back to `home` to recharge.
*   **Total Battery Cost:** `(1 + (N-1) + 1) moves * 20 battery/move` + `N explanations * 10 battery/explanation`
    *   This simplifies to: `(N+1) * 20 + N * 10` = `20N + 20 + 10N` = `30N + 20`.
*   **Finding Maximum `N`:** The total cost must be less than or equal to the battery capacity (100).
    *   `30N + 20 <= 100`
    *   `30N <= 80`
    *   `N <= 2.66...`
*   **Conclusion:** The maximum number of paintings the robot can visit and explain in a single, complete tour (including returning home) is **2**.

**2. The Recharge Cycle**

Based on the calculation, the optimal strategy is to perform tours of 2 paintings at a time.

*   **Tour Cost:** A 2-painting tour costs `30*2 + 20 = 80` battery units.
*   **Recharge Necessity:** After completing a 2-painting tour and returning to `home`, the robot will have `100 - 80 = 20` battery units remaining. While this is enough to perform another `move` action, it is not enough to complete another tour. Therefore, upon arriving at `home`, the robot must execute the `recharge` action to restore its battery to 100 before starting the next tour. This is a necessary recharge to continue its mission.

**3. Plan Structure**

The complete plan is structured as follows:

*   **Initial Action:** The plan starts with `(start_welcome tiago)`.
*   **Main Loops:** There are 31 paintings in total. The plan will execute 15 tours, each explaining 2 paintings. This covers `15 * 2 = 30` paintings. Each of these tours follows the pattern: `move -> explain -> move -> explain -> move_to_home -> recharge`.
*   **Final Action:** After 30 paintings are explained, the robot is at `home` with a full battery. For the final (31st) painting, it only needs to travel to the location and explain it. An unnecessary return trip to `home` is avoided to maximize efficiency, as the goal is met once the last painting is explained.

Each `explain_painting` action is included in the plan because the goal is to have all paintings explained (`(explained_painting ...)` for every location). The plan systematically visits each location to satisfy these goals.

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)

(:goal
  (and
    Explicame TODOS los cuadros
    (explained_painting ...)
  
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not.

"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic

)

  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)

    Explicame TODOS los cuadros

)

response:
Step-by-step reasoning while planning:

1. Start: battery = 100, at home (charger).
2. Goal is to explain every painting.  
   The paintings that appear in the problem are exactly the 30 locations that are not “home”.  
   Therefore the planner must visit and explain all 30 of them.

3. Battery budget per “useful” move:
   - 20 to move to a painting location.
   - 10 to explain it.
   - 20 to leave that location.
   ⇒ 50 battery are consumed for every painting that is actually explained.  
   With 100 battery we can therefore do two full paintings (2×50 = 100) before we are empty.

4. Recharge policy:
   - After the second explanation we have 0 battery left, so we must be at a charger before we attempt the next move.
   - The only charger in the problem is “home”.
   - Hence, after every second explanation we return to home, recharge once (5 s), and immediately start the next pair.

5. Sequence that follows:
   - Pair 1: move→explain→move→explain (battery 100→0).
   - Return to home, recharge (battery 0→100).
   - Pair 2: move→explain→move→explain (battery 100→0).
   - Return to home, recharge … and so on for 15 complete pairs (30 paintings).

6. No extra moves or recharges are ever required; the above pattern is optimal in number of actions and total time.

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"

(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus

)

)

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)

(:goal
  (and
    Explicame TODOS los cuadros
    (explained_painting ...)
  
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"
response:
Step-by-step reasoning while planning:

1. Battery budget: start at 100.  
   - Each move costs 20 → after 5 moves battery = 0.  
   - Each explain costs 10 → after 10 explains battery = 0.  
   - Recharge is only possible at home (the only charger).  
   - Recharge takes 5 s and resets battery to 100.  
   - Objective: explain every painting location (all 30 locations must have explained_painting = true).

2. Since we must visit 30 locations and explain each, we need at least 30 explains (300 battery) plus the moves to reach them.  
   - 100 battery units allow 5 moves (100/20).  
   - Therefore, after every 5 moves we must return to home to recharge.  
   - While at a location we can explain it (cost 10) without affecting the “moves-until-recharge” counter.

3. Planning strategy:  
   - Group locations into clusters of ≤5 moves from home.  
   - After each cluster, return to home, recharge, and start the next cluster.  
   - While inside a cluster, explain every location right after arriving.

4. Clustering (Manhattan-like distance on an implicit grid; here we just count moves):  
   Cluster 1 (4 moves): home → maestro_aprendiz → elgrito → guernica → la_joven_de_la_perla  
   Cluster 2 (4 moves): home → monalisa → noche_estrellada → las_meninas → el_3_de_mayo  
   Cluster 3 (4 moves): home → el_jardin → las_tres_gracias → la_rendicion → el_nacimiento  
   Cluster 4 (4 moves): home → la_creacion → la_ultima_cena → la_libertad → el_hijo  
   Cluster 5 (4 moves): home → american_gothic → la_persistencia → la_ronda → impresion_sol  
   Cluster 6 (4 moves): home → banistas → saturno → whistlers → la_gran_ola  
   Cluster 7 (4 moves): home → el_beso → autorretrato → el_carnaval → nighthawks  
   Cluster 8 (2 moves): home → retrato_adele → campbells → composition_viii  

   Each cluster keeps moves ≤5, so we never run out of battery before returning home.

5. Execution inside one cluster:  
   - Move to first location (cost 20).  
   - Explain it (cost 10).  
   - Repeat for next locations.  
   - After last location, move back to home (cost 20), recharge (cost 0, resets to 100).

6. All 30 locations are explained, so the goal is satisfied.

You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)

(:goal
  (and
    Explicame TODOS los cuadros
    (explained_painting ...)
  
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"

problem:
"
(define (problem library_problem)
(:domain library_domain)

(:objects
  home monalisa nocheestrellada elgrito maestro_aprendiz guernica la_joven_de_la_perla las_meninas el_3_de_mayo_de_1808 
  el_jardin_de_las_delicias las_tres_gracias la_rendicion_de_breda el_nacimiento_de_venus
  la_creacion_de_adan la_ultima_cena la_libertad_guiando_al_pueblo el_hijo_del_hombre american_gothic 
  la_persistencia_de_la_memoria la_ronda_de_noche impresion_sol_naciente banistas_en_asnieres 
  saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo whistlers_mother la_gran_ola_de_kanagawa el_beso autorretrato_con_collar_de_espinas 
  el_carnaval_del_arlequin nighthawks retrato_de_adele_bloch_bauer_i campbells_soup_cans composition_viii - location
  tiago - robot
)

(:init
  (robot_at tiago home)
  (initial_state tiago)
  (= (battery tiago) 100)
  (charger_at home)
)


(:goal
    (and
      (visited tiago monalisa)
      (visited tiago elgrito)
      (visited tiago guernica)
      (visited tiago nocheestrellada)
      (explained_painting monalisa)
      (explained_painting elgrito)
      (explained_painting maestro_aprendiz)
      (explained_painting guernica)
      (explained_painting la_joven_de_la_perla)
      (explained_painting las_meninas)
      (explained_painting el_3_de_mayo_de_1808)
      (explained_painting el_jardin_de_las_delicias)
  )
)
"

The most important thing in the plan is that you consider the battery.
Starting with 100, moving consumes 20, and explaining consumes 10. Therefore, you must recharge the robot before the battery runs out. If you have 20 battery, the action must be MOVE TO HOME to recharge.

REMEMBER, THE OUTPUT MUST ALWAYS HAVE THIS FORMAT.

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]


Give me de step by step explanation of when you should recharge de robot, when you are planning and explaining a painting,
tell me why you are explaining the drawing and if it was in the goal or not. 

But at the end do:
"
PLAN: 
(AND GIVE THE PLAN WITH CORRECT FORMAT)
"
response:
**Step‑by‑step explanation**

1. **Start** – `start_welcome` puts the robot in a state where it can act.  
2. **Visit Monalisa** – move from *home* to *monalisa* (‑20 battery) and explain the painting (‑10).  
3. **Visit El Grito** – move to *elgrito* (‑20) and explain it (‑10). Battery is now 40, not enough to return home, so we move back to *home* (‑20) and recharge to full (100).  
4. **First recharge segment** – from *home* go to *guernica* (‑20) and explain it (‑10), then to *nocheestrellada* (‑20, no explanation), then to *maestro_aprendiz* (‑20) and explain it (‑10). Battery is 20, just enough to go back home (‑20) and recharge again.  
5. **Second recharge segment** – after recharging, visit *la_joven_de_la_perla* (‑20, explain ‑10) and *las_meninas* (‑20, explain ‑10). Battery is 40, so we return home (‑20) and recharge.  
6. **Final segment** – with a full battery, move to *el_3_de_mayo_de_1808* (‑20, explain ‑10) and then to *el_jardin_de_las_delicias* (‑20, explain ‑10). All goal locations are visited and all required paintings are explained. No further recharge is needed.

All goals are satisfied with **three** recharges, the minimum possible because the charger exists only at *home* and the total battery consumption exceeds one full charge.

---

The robot starts with a full battery (100).  
- Each **move** costs 20 battery units and takes 15 time units.  
- Each **explain_painting** costs 10 battery units and also takes 15 time units.  
- The robot can only **recharge** at locations that have a charger; in this problem the only charger is at **home**.  

To minimise recharges we group actions so that each charge can handle at most two explanations (30 battery each) plus the moves needed to reach them and return home (20 battery). This yields four segments:

1. **Segment 1** – Explain *monalisa* and *elgrito*, then visit *nocheestrellada* and return home.  
2. **Segment 2** – Explain *maestro_aprendiz* and *guernica*, then return home.  
3. **Segment 3** – Explain *la_joven_de_la_perla* and *las_meninas*, then return home.  
4. **Segment 4** – Explain *el_3_de_mayo_de_1808* and *el_jardin_de_las_delicias* (no final return needed).

Each segment starts with a full battery after a **recharge** (except the first, which starts after `start_welcome`). The battery never drops below the required thresholds for moves (≥20) or explanations (≥10). All required locations are visited and all required paintings are explained.

Let's analyze the problem step by step, considering battery usage, the need to recharge, and when explanations or visits are demanded by the goal.

**Initial State:**  
- Robot at `home` with battery at 100.
- Charger available at `home`.

**Goal Analysis:**  
- Must **visit**: `monalisa`, `elgrito`, `guernica`, `nocheestrellada`.
- Must **explain**:  
  - `monalisa` (**goal**)  
  - `elgrito` (**goal**)  
  - `maestro_aprendiz` (**goal**)  
  - `guernica` (**goal**)  
  - `la_joven_de_la_perla` (**goal**)  
  - `las_meninas` (**goal**)  
  - `el_3_de_mayo_de_1808` (**goal**)  
  - `el_jardin_de_las_delicias` (**goal**)

### Step by Step Planning:

#### Step 1: Start Welcome Action
- Battery: 100  
- Action: `(start_welcome tiago)`  
- This is required by the domain; it enables other actions.

#### Step 2: Which to Visit/Explain First?
We are at `home`, which also has a charger. Let's make a plan sequence to minimize moves and recharges.

#### Step 3: Plan Efficient Route
Assume the optimal route is as below (you didn't provide connectivity/adjacency, so I assume direct moves are possible):
- Start at `home`, then go to:  
  1. `maestro_aprendiz` (must explain here)
  2. `elgrito` (visit & explain)
  3. `guernica` (visit & explain)
  4. `nocheestrellada` (visit only)
  5. `monalisa` (visit & explain)
  6. `la_joven_de_la_perla` (explain only)
  7. `las_meninas` (explain only)
  8. `el_3_de_mayo_de_1808` (explain only)
  9. `el_jardin_de_las_delicias` (explain only)

"Visited" can be satisfied by "robot_at" at end of move.

Let's check battery usage for each operation:
- Move: -20, Explain: -10.

Suppose our route:
- home → maestro_aprendiz → elgrito → guernica → nocheestrellada → monalisa → (continue with remaining for explanation only).

Let's enumerate actions, noting battery at each step.

---

- Start: battery 100
  1. (start_welcome) [1]  
  2. move home → maestro_aprendiz [15]: battery 80

prompt:
You are a planner for PDDL and I only want you to give me the execution plan. You need to take into account the following:

1.The robot has a battery that is consumed with each movement and action.
2.The battery must be recharged when necessary, but you should minimize the number of recharges and movements to make the plan as efficient as possible.
3.Maximize efficiency regarding battery usage, performing recharges only when absolutely necessary and only at locations that have chargers.
4.Do not make any comments or additional explanations. I only want the plan.
5.Do not invent actions or make unnecessary actions.

I will provide you with the domain and the problem. The only output I expect from you is the execution plan, as a set of actions, with their start times and durations. The structure of the plan should be the following:

0.000: (start_welcome tiago) [1.000]
1.001: (move tiago home maestro_aprendiz) [15.000]
16.002: (move tiago maestro_aprendiz elgrito) [15.000]
31.002: (explain_painting tiago elgrito) [15.000]
46.002: (move tiago elgrito guernica) [15.000]
...
Now I will provide the domain and the problem. ONLY RESPOND WITH THE PLAN, NOTHING ELSE.

dominio :
"
(define (domain library_domain)

(:requirements :strips :fluents :durative-actions :typing)

(:types 
  robot
  location 
  painting
)

(:predicates
  (robot_at ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (painting_at ?b - painting ?l - location)
  (painting_found ?b - painting)
  (explained_painting ?p - location)
  (can_start ?r - robot)
  (initial_state ?r - robot)
  (visited ?r - robot ?l - location)
  (charger_at ?wp - location)
)

(:functions
  (battery ?r - robot)
)

(:durative-action start_welcome
  :parameters (?r - robot)
  :duration (= ?duration 1)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (can_start ?r))
    (at start (initial_state ?r))
  )
)

(:durative-action move
  :parameters (?r - robot ?from ?to - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 20))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
    (at start (robot_at ?r ?from))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at start (not(robot_at ?r ?from)))
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 20))
    (at end (robot_at ?r ?to))
    (at end (visited ?r ?to))
  )
)

(:durative-action explain_painting
  :parameters (?r - robot ?p - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 15)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (>= (battery ?r) 10))
    (over all (robot_at ?r   ?p))
    (at start (can_start ?r))
  )
  :effect (and 
    (at end (explained_painting ?p)) 
    (at start (decrease (battery ?r) 10))
  )
)

(:durative-action recharge
  :parameters (?r - robot ?wp - location)
  :duration (= ?duration 5)
  :condition (and 
    (at start (<= (battery ?r) 100))
    (over all (robot_at ?r ?wp))
    (over all (charger_at ?wp))
  )
  :effect (and (at end (assign (battery ?r) 100)))
)
"
